billEvents.eventText: referred to corporations, authorities and commissions

title: Relates to the age eligibility for voting and holding office in episcopal churches
summary: Relates to the age eligibility for voting and holding office in episcopal churches.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3036

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN ACT to amend the religious corporations law, in relation to  the  age
         eligibility of members to vote and hold office in the protestant epis-
         copal parishes

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 6 of section 43 of the  religious  corporations
    2  law,  as  amended by chapter 171 of the laws of 1974, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    6. Persons of full age belonging to the parish, who have been baptized
    5  and are regular attendants  at  its  worship  and  contributors  to  its
    6  support  for  at  least  twelve months prior to such election or special
    7  meeting or since the establishment of such parish,  shall  be  qualified
    8  voters  at  any such election or special meeting.  Whenever so permitted
    9  by the canons of the diocese, persons of less than full age, but of  the
   10  age  of [eighteen] SIXTEEN years or more, and having like qualifications
   11  except as to age, may vote at the annual elections and special  meetings
   12  of  any  parish of such diocese, whenever such parish shall so determine
   13  in the manner provided in [said] section forty-six OF THIS ARTICLE.
   14    S 2. Section 49 of the religious corporations law, as amended by chap-
   15  ter 900 of the laws of 1972, is amended to read as follows:
   16    S 49. Eligibility of certain minors as lay delegates and to  vote  and
   17  hold  office.  Whenever  the  constitution or canons of a diocese of the
   18  Protestant Episcopal church in the state of New York so permits, persons
   19  of less than full age but of the age of [eighteen] SIXTEEN years or more
   20  shall be eligible to serve as lay  delegates  to  and  to  vote  at  any
   21  convention of the diocese, when duly chosen by the parish or mission and
   22  shall  also be eligible for election to or appointment to any lay office
   23  of the diocese.
   24    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05458-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the religious corporations law, in relation to the age eligibility of members to vote and hold office in the protestant episcopal parishes
